instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
Hi, happy to join the group!

MacBook will suddenly not charge when it's turned on.
If I shut it down, it charges normally (orange led, goes green when full).
After I turn it on it keeps the green led on until OSX starts up, then the light goes off.

It didn't work with the battery, it had a green flashing LED. I found a problem on the PPBus that was on the <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. I changed and the PPBus was normal. But with the problem of only charging off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage w/ and w/o battery.
Is the battery recognized and its percentage correctly showed by macOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
Thank you friend!

Pins 17/18 - 3ohms
Pins 27/28 - 20 ohms
PPBus without battery - 12.56
PPBus with battery - starts at 11.8 and goes up to 12.56
PPBus with running system, without LED - 11.5

I noticed that when the system comes in, the LED goes out, the charger only works again if I take it out of the socket and put it back in again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
I forgot.

Yes, the system recognizes the battery and shows the percentage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
Magsafe light is not related with macOS.
Try known good DCIN board.
Also test with another 85W Magsafe 2 charger and fake charger, or lab PSU  too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
I've tried it with another DCIN and another 85w magsafe 2, same thing.

I don't have a fake charger! with the PSU, it's recognized! With the system working, I place the original and it works. If I restart the mac, the original stops working!

threads.message:

Now I'm trying to solve problem with display's BKL! I did something stupid that the F7700 opened! even after switching, it did not give BKL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
BKL is back. But strangely, if the Mac goes to sleep, the BKL doesn't come back.

With BKL working: P1 - 7.2v / P2 - 45.6v
When it runs out of BKL, 0v pins

Anything bad soldering? I will keep checking this and give feedback.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
Do you mean sleep closing the lid, or even software sleep?
Do PRAM reset 2-3 times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
in both! If you let it go to rest or close the lid, the BKL will not come back.

Had already tried reset PRAM.

Problem with charging returned! Crazy logic! I'll keep checking the welds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:

When the charger is not recognized...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
I'm back to mac work.

Checked pin voltages, no battery connected.
1: 0
2: 20v
3: 4.5v
9:0
12: 3.3v
13: 3v
14: 2.27v
15:0
17: 12.56v
19: 5.45v
20: 5.45v
27: 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
threads.message:
"27: 0"
Are you sure?
If yes, check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and their traces.

Sorry, I was wrong.

Pin 27: 19.76v

threads.message:
I noticed that the logic doesn't present the problem when it's alone, only with the battery and SSD.

I was testing putting it in the topcase and connecting the other items. It seems like when I plug in the trackpad, that's when the problem happens. Tried with another trackpad, and same problem. I'm checking it out!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery only charges when off
